item.title: 8.1 Deploying containers with Container Instances
item.description: 8.1 Deploying containers with Container Instances OCI Container Instances Container Orchestration is commonly used with Kubernetes to consume container applications. Alternatively, you can simply run containers by directly installing Docker Engine on a virtual machine. At this time, the user must manage Kubernetes or Docker Engine. Container Instances are managed by cloud service providers, not by users of Container Orchestration. Users can simply deploy and use containers, and have the advantage of only paying for the resources directly used by containers.
